name: Disney's Animal Kingdom Villas - Kidani Village

reviews.text: Spent MLK weekend there with my kids. It had been a few years since I stayed there, and I had forgotten how incredible the resort is. We had a partial view of the savannah so we saw a lot of different animals. My kids loved it.
reviews.title: Animal Kingdom Lodge

reviews.text: The room was nice. The bathroom was spectacular.
reviews.title: Fantastic DVC location

reviews.text: A one bed villa with savanna views, where else could be better to spend Christmas?
reviews.title: Worth the extra money!

reviews.text: The one bed villa was more than big enough for the four of us with two bathrooms, kitchen and lounge area. The hotel is very well put together as you would expect from Disney and you really get the African feeling throughout, the food in the Asian themed restaurant Is great and to wake up with Giraffe, Zebra, Wildebeast and Antelpoe outside your balcony was amazing.
reviews.title: Blown away by this resort and our Grand Villa.

reviews.text: With busses to all the parks unning all day getting about could not be easier.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Great Views

reviews.text: I should start by saying I am very into resort ROOMS and not as worried about conveniences like the fact that Kidani Village is pretty remote from Magic Kingdom. I loved our room (1 bedroom villa), large bedroom, bathroom, living area, as well as an additional bathroom in the living area (Jambo House 1 bedrooms do not have this feature). We are a family of four and the kids slept on the pull out couch which was quite comfortable for a pull out couch. Bedding in the master bedroom was also very comfortable. Bus service at this resort was great, we never waited very long for a bus. We did not use room service so I cannot speak to that. We loved Sanaa and had wonderful service there as well as our meals. The pool at Kidani is great for kids, with one big slide and then a zero-entry part to it which is where my 3 year old and I hung out. There is also the splash and play area but we did not really utilize that. The fitness center is near the pool, which is kind of a pain, I would rather see it inside the actual resort. The one downside is that there is no quick service option at Kidani. We luckily had kitchen and rental car so this was not a big issue for us but if you were staying in a studio with no kitchen and had to walk to Jambo for everything, it would be a little bit of a hike. I should add as well we checked in immediately upon arrival which was early, around noon, our room just happened to be ready. I'm sure this isn't always the case but it definitely added to the "magic" of our first day. We will be staying here again in July. I would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Love the rooms at this resort!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in January 2013 - 2 bedroom suite for the 6 of us
reviews.title: Very nice but had frustrations

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: A Magical Christmas

reviews.text: Very large suite, clean, comfortable
reviews.title: Below Average Service Brings Down Above Average Property

reviews.text: King in master bedroom, 2 queen in 2nd bedroom
reviews.title: excellent rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been here before and have loved this resort. I still love it but there were a few things on this trip that were a little distressing. There is only one pool in Kidani and it was pretty busy for January. They do not have a quiet pool like some of the other DVC resorts. Also my savannah view room had very limited viewing of the animals. We saw one giraffe, some wildebeasts and 1 ostrich. Most of the other animals were in other areas or too far away for viewing from our balcony. I love the theme of this resort. It has a nice feel and you really do think you are in Africa. However be aware that the resort is rather dark and so is the room. It is hard to get adjusted to that and it is difficult to figure out how to control all of the lighting in the room. I would return here because it is just so calming and more peaceful then some of the other disney resorts. The parking garage is underground and that has its pros and cons. I have not eaten in the restaurants in kidani or jambo house but everyone says they are all excellent. The staff is usually very accommodating here.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed this time

reviews.text: We loved everything about this hotel stayed 1st week of dec and it was amazing. We had a two bedroom savanah view and it was just beautiful and very spacious. We were sorry we did not spend more time at this resort, next time we definitely will. This is our home resort and we will gladly stay here every year. We have stayed in almost every deluxe resort and this is our favorite by far. .
reviews.title: outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with most things that are affiliated with Disney, the customer service was amazing and the pricing was baffling. We lucked out with pricing by purchasing DVC points through a 3rd party vendor which allowed for us to book the rooms here for the price Disney would typically charge for a moderate resort. Otherwise there'd be no way we'd be able to stay here. Since it was a DVC room, we didn't really get to experience the house keeping during our stay but we can say that the rooms were wonderful and clean when we came in plus there was an efficiency kitchen that is helpful should you wish to cook something and cut down on food costs at Disney. The bed was smaller than we expected but they were very comfortable. Because of the location, you can wait a long time before a bus servicing this hotel gets to you. One quirk of this location is that the rooms are spaced VERY far apart so if you're not near the lobby, you will be walking a long time to get to your room. (This can be an issue if you're tired from walking around the parks all day and you find out upon getting to your room you have to return to the lobby to get something from the store)
reviews.title: Great service, great view, LONG WALK to room.

reviews.text: Hello everyone! My family and I went to Disney for the Christmas holiday, we stayed at Kidani Vilalge (Animal Kingdom) we had such a nice time. The villas over there are really nice. I really appreciated the fact that they had 2 bathrooms in there 1 bedroom villas. it was a good thing to have in the morning with kids. The Buses were always on time, and they had shuttle buses to take you to and from Kidani over to Jambo house that ran every 15 minutes. Some days we walked over and that was ok as well. All in all I really liked the hotel.
reviews.title: A Quiet Visit, Away from Home

reviews.text: This was the 4th year staying at Animal Kingdom Lodge Kidani Village for the January Disney Marathon Weekend. As with the previous times, everything was top notch. The few "new" differences from previous stays - check in was supposed to be faster and more convenient if you do online check-in and simply pick-up your room keys at a designated desk. However, we were met at the front door by a cast member who "helped" us with check-in instead. This seemed to be slightly longer and a bit more of a production than the standard check-in used to be. Everything else throughout the stay in relation to the resort was outstanding. Room entry was updated to the new RFID system. Although we never had issues with the magnetic strips in the past, the new card entry is much easier.
reviews.title: Consistently awesome

reviews.text: I spent 7 nights and 7 great days here at Kidani Village. Came to run the Disney half marathon, which was super fun, and had a great time relaxing around the pool here. Had several opportunities to observe the animals:giraffes, zebras, East African crowned cranes, ostriches, wildebeest, Roan antelope, and Eland. Restaurant was marvelous but that is a different review. In addition managed to do 4 days at Disney parks, a day at Sea World, and a day at Universal.
reviews.title: Cool Animals and good friends
Fantastic resort with great pool and views
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom savannah view villa. We had 4 adults and 2 kids. The room was great , plenty of room for all and looking out to see all the animals was awesome. We saw giraffe, zebras, ostriches, cattle and many more. The room was a tad dark but that is part of the theming.
The bus ride was quick and easy from here. The bus picks up and drops off at Kidani first so that is nice.
reviews.title: Our of this world!

reviews.text: The only small drawback is the lack of a counter service for a quick bite. They do have a shuttle to the other building do it isn't a big deal.
reviews.title: 2nd stay nice place

reviews.text: The pool is a must see. It has a huge waterside and a splash park for kids. It was great!
reviews.title: Extremely nice

aka: Disney`s Animal Kingdom Villas - Kidani Village Hotel Orlando
description: Disney's Animal Kingdom Villas – Kidani Village is an African lodge-style Resort boasting accommodations that include kitchenettes/kitchens and multi-bedroom units. Featuring over 30 species of wildlife that roam free amidst a 21-acre wildlife preserve that includes lush, tropical savannas, Disney's Animal Kingdom Villas – Kidani Village offers you the unique opportunity to observe exotic animals in their natural habitat from special viewing areas throughout the Resort – and from the balconies of select Guest rooms.
